body_html: Yes, it turns out that bazel creates the files as read-only by default. To prevent this from happening on subsequent builds you can add a "fileMode 0644" to the copyNativeLibs task in build.gradle (I'm in the process of submitting a fix for this currently).
body_text: Yes, it turns out that bazel creates the files as read-only by default. To prevent this from happening on subsequent builds you can add a "fileMode 0644" to the copyNativeLibs task in build.gradle (I'm in the process of submitting a fix for this currently).
body: Yes, it turns out that bazel creates the files as read-only by default. To prevent this from happening on subsequent builds you can add a "fileMode 0644" to the copyNativeLibs task in build.gradle (I'm in the process of submitting a fix for this currently).
